questions.question: What is Artificial Intelligence?
options: The simulation of human intelligence in machines.
A new type of computer hardware.

questions.question: What is Machine Learning?
options: A field of AI where systems learn from data and improve automatically.
A way to manually program machines to perform fixed tasks.
A database used for storage only.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of AI in daily life?
options: Voice assistants like Siri or Alexa

questions.question: Which of these is used to train a machine learning model?
What is a dataset?
options: A collection of data used to train or test a model.

questions.question: What is supervised learning?
options: Training a model using labeled data (inputs with known outputs).
Training a model without any data.

questions.question: What is unsupervised learning?
options: Training a model with unlabeled data to find patterns or groups.
Training with correct answers already given.
Manual training by a human supervisor.

questions.question: What is reinforcement learning?
options: An AI learns by trial and error using rewards or penalties.
A system that memorizes all data.
A learning method based only on text files.
A model that doesn’t use feedback.

questions.question: What is a model in machine learning?
options: A program trained to make predictions or decisions from data.

questions.question: What is training in ML?
options: The process of teaching a model by providing data and adjusting parameters.
Creating a database for storing files.
Testing how fast an algorithm runs.

questions.question: What is testing in ML?
options: Evaluating how well a trained model performs on unseen data.

questions.question: What is overfitting?
options: When a model performs well on training data but poorly on new data.
When a model performs perfectly on all data.
When a model is too small to learn anything.
When a model has no parameters.

questions.question: What is underfitting?
options: When a model is too simple and fails to learn important patterns.
When a model memorizes all training data.
When a model has too many layers.
When training data is too large.

questions.question: What is a neural network?
options: A system inspired by the human brain that processes information in layers.
A social network for AI developers.
A computer network for storing files.
A set of predefined rules for data entry.

questions.question: What is deep learning?
options: A type of machine learning using neural networks with many layers.
A method of writing long code files.

questions.question: Which of these is a popular ML library in Python?
Which algorithm is commonly used for classification?
Which algorithm is commonly used for clustering?
What is regression used for in ML?
What is classification in ML?
options: Predicting categories or labels (e.g., spam or not spam).

questions.question: What is a feature in a dataset?
options: An individual measurable property or variable.
A section of code that trains a model.

questions.question: What is a label in ML?
options: The correct output or category for a given data point.

questions.question: What is bias in machine learning?
options: Error due to oversimplifying a model or data.
A type of neural network layer.

questions.question: What is data preprocessing?
options: Cleaning and preparing raw data before training.
Running the final model on production.

questions.question: What is AI mainly used for?
options: Automating tasks, recognizing patterns, and making intelligent decisions.

questions.question: Which of the following is an AI application?
What is Natural Language Processing (NLP)?
options: A branch of AI that helps computers understand human language.
A method to compress audio files.

questions.question: What is computer vision?
options: A field of AI that enables computers to interpret and process visual information.
A hardware component in graphics cards.
